config_description: Cannot found this configuration description for this configuration.
developer_understanding_on_working: The 'haltOnError' configuration option is checked in the code to determine if the system should stop processing further jobs and shutdown the thread pool if an exception occurs. If 'haltOnError' is true, the system will cancel the current job, shutdown the thread pool, and invoke the callback with an indication that the job was finished with an error.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The 'haltOnError' configuration is triggered whenever an exception occurs during job processing. It is not triggered periodically but rather conditionally based on the presence of an exception and the value of 'haltOnError'.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'haltOnError' configuration option is significant as it can halt the processing of jobs and shutdown the thread pool in case of an exception. This can affect the overall system performance and job completion depending on how frequently exceptions occur and the importance of processing all jobs regardless of errors.
